Galen.Action: Carries the candelabra up the stairs and alerts Magister Ulrich that something is wrong.
Shows concern and asks Ulrich what has happened after noticing his grim expression.
Carries the candelabra up the circular staircase and alerts Magister Ulrich that something is wrong.
Appears discouraged and taken aback by Ulrich's grim countenance.
Admits to not daring to try the Ritual of Banishment and questions its point.
Expresses hatred for books and drills, desires a real task.
Instinctively wraps his hand around the amulet Ulrich gives him, showing trust or appreciation.
Claims to have almost mastered the threefold transmutation but admits to only memorizing the first two chapters of the Codex de Profundis and not attempting the Ritual of Banishment.
Expresses disdain for books and drills, showing impatience with traditional learning methods and a desire for real tasks.
Responds quickly to the amulet and hears voices on the road, showing alertness and responsiveness to his environment.
Helps Ulrich prepare for the audience, handing him his sticks and engaging in light-hearted banter.
Comments on Ulrich's morbid frame of mind with a gentle, reassuring tone.
Helps Ulrich prepare for the audience, assists with props and practical matters.
Does not see anything when looking for signs or threats, appears somewhat unaware or distracted.
Makes an entrance with an expressionless face and hands pressed together, allowing a moment to pass before signaling Ulrich's dramatic appearance.
Nods affirmatively when asked about wearing the amulet, showing awareness and adherence to instructions.
Remains passive and expressionless during Ulrich's magical display without taking any independent action or showing initiative.
Edges over to the table and inspects the scales and tooth, attempting to engage with the evidence and situation.
Is silenced by Ulrich before fully expressing his thoughts, showing hesitation or lack of confidence in presence of authority.
Crouches sullenly and regards his master silently, showing reluctance to engage.
Mocks Ulrich sarcastically about his crutches and journey, showing impatience and lack of sympathy.
Calls out to the Urlanders to draw straws to carry Ulrich, teasing but involving others.
Asks to be sent on the journey himself, expressing eagerness and willingness to prove himself.
Crouches sullenly and does not respond when spoken to directly by Ulrich.
Sarcastically questions Ulrich's ability to travel on crutches, showing critical thinking and awareness of practical limitations.
Suggests drawing straws to decide who will carry Ulrich, demonstrating initiative and practical problem-solving.
Asks to be sent on the journey to gain experience, showing eagerness to learn and confidence in his own abilities.
Senses trouble and moves forward to intervene, but obeys Ulrich's urgent command to say nothing.
Insists he is ready and asks to be sent despite Ulrich's warning that he is not ready.
Senses trouble and moves forward but obeys Ulrich's urgent instruction to say nothing.
Hesitates before tossing the dagger, showing alarm and caution.
Eagerly examines the dagger, showing curiosity and engagement.
Follows Ulrich's order promptly and retrieves the dagger from the iron box despite initial alarm.
Examines the dagger carefully to understand if it is a trick or genuine.
Hesitates before tossing the dagger as instructed, showing some uncertainty.
Attempts to escape captivity by trying multiple exits and climbing down a vine.
Presses his face to a crack in the shutter to witness the violent scene below, holding his breath in fear.
Turns away from the window and gazes blankly into the gloomy room after witnessing the death.
Rushes for the door to escape but is repeatedly trapped as doors and shutters close on him, locking him in.
Stops hammering and carefully observes the scene through a crack, holding his breath to avoid detection.
Turns away from the window and gazes blankly into the gloom after witnessing the stabbing and Ulrich's death.
Releases the crow, falcon, and owl from their cages after the funeral pyre ritual.
Sows salt over the pentagram and carefully secures the magical items, showing respect for the old man's effects.
Approaches Hodge and questions him about his actions, showing concern and engagement.
Sits alone, silently contemplating the amulet and the situation, showing introspection but no outward warmth.
Touches a burning brand to the kindling, causing flames to turn pale green and produce an unearthly roar, standing his ground despite intense heat and blinking back tears.
Sits alone considering the significance of the amulet, showing thoughtful reflection.
Sets his jaw with resolve and methodically secures the old man's effects: locking books and parchments, covering devices, sowing salt over the pentagram, and releasing caged birds.
Questions Hodge about his actions, showing awareness and concern.
No indication of hesitation or confusion despite the intense and possibly dangerous magical fire, showing confidence and skill.
Uses powerful magic to animate vines and cover the castle quickly, showing excitement and confidence in his abilities.
Clutches amulet tightly and ignores Hodge's fearful look, showing focus on his task rather than concern for others' feelings.
Successfully animates the vines on the castle walls to rapidly cover the entire structure, demonstrating powerful and effective magic.
Ignores Hodge's warning about being careful with the amulet and proceeds confidently with the spell.
Shows excitement and possibly overconfidence after performing the magic, failing to notice Hodge's fearful look.
Expresses shared grief with Hodge, saying 'Me too...'
Playfully teases Hodge by making his pack float and draping a coat over him, then removing his clothes, but stops when Hodge protests and restores him respectfully
Transforms a leaf into a spray of daffodils with a wave of his hand, demonstrating magical skill.
Playfully manipulates Hodge's pack and coat, showing control over magic but also a lack of seriousness in a solemn moment.
Claims 'I'm master now' confidently, indicating self-assurance but possibly overconfidence given Hodge's warning about filling the master's shoes.
Greets the group peacefully and says 'Easy now. We mean no harm.'
Brushing himself off and speaking confidently about taking over Ulrich's role.
Approaches a suspicious group calmly and confidently, asserting his identity and purpose clearly.
Takes over the role of a deceased sorcerer by declaring himself the inheritor of the craft and knowledge, showing readiness to face dangers and fulfill tasks.
Brushes himself off after being captured, indicating composure under pressure.
Fails to immediately convince the group, leading to a moment of depressed silence and skepticism.
Allows Valerian to protect him from Greil's attack without resistance.
Nods silently when given food by Valerian, showing trust and acceptance.
Does not escalate conflict or respond aggressively to Greil's hostility.
Jumps back quickly to avoid Greil's sudden attack with the knife.
Allows Valerian to intervene and protect him rather than defending himself.
Nods silently when given food and asks calmly about Greil's behavior.
Engages Hodge with teasing jokes despite Hodge's hostility.
Defends himself calmly against Hodge's insults without escalating conflict.
Suggests Hodge could leave if he dislikes the journey, implying respect for his choice.
Walks back along the trail looking for Valerian when he notices he is missing, showing concern.
Engages Hodge in conversation, attempts to use humor to lighten mood.
Walks back along the trail to look for Valerian when he notices him missing.
Encourages Valerian not to get separated from the group, showing concern for safety.
Swims out to Valerian despite her reluctance, demonstrating friendliness and willingness to connect.
Keeps swimming after Valerian asks him to stop, showing some disregard for her wishes.
Does not reveal Valerian's secret after discovering her true identity, showing trustworthiness and respect for her privacy.
Responds to Valerian's self-blame with a feeble bluff to comfort her, indicating a gentle, if uncertain, attempt at kindness.
Leads Valerian to not get separated and insists on staying together.
Decides to swim out to Valerian despite her reluctance, showing confidence and decisiveness.
Surprised and gasps upon discovering Valerian is not a boy, indicating a momentary lapse in observation or assumption.
Keeps calm and promises not to tell others about Valerian's secret, showing discretion and emotional intelligence.
Attempts a feeble bluff to calm Valerian, which may indicate some social awkwardness or lack of confidence in handling the situation.
Reassures Valerian that no one will find out her secret, asks her why.
Reacting with horror to the vision of Tyrian about to shoot an arrow, showing concern.
Sprints after Valerian to stop her despite her grim resolve to keep walking.
Kneels beside Hodge who is seriously wounded, showing care and concern.
Feigns confidence with a feeble bluff when confronted (says 'Take it easy' but is clearly not convincing).
Notices a mysterious vision in the water and immediately pursues it, showing alertness and quick reaction.
Sprints through the forest to catch up with Valerian and then races to aid Hodge, demonstrating decisiveness and urgency.
Kneels beside wounded Hodge, listens to his last words, and tries to comfort him by telling him he won't die.
Frantically attempts to use magic to save Hodge despite the risk to himself.
Shows visible distress and pain when his magic burns his hand and fails to save Hodge.
Prying the leather pouch from Hodge's clenched fingers despite resistance.
Attempting to use magic to revive Hodge by chanting and shaking the body.
Failing to save Hodge despite frantic efforts, resulting in visible pain from the amulet and witnessed failure.
Showing awareness of others' presence and their judgment after failure.
Inspects the surroundings with interest and insists on approaching the lair despite warnings.
Fingers the iron manacles thoughtfully, showing contemplation rather than fear or cruelty.
Ignores companions' concern and pushes forward alone, showing determination but also disregard for others' worries.
Inspects the surroundings carefully and shows interest in the environment.
Disregards warnings and climbs toward the lair despite others' concerns.
Questions about other entrances, showing strategic thinking.
Ignores advice to turn back and insists on approaching the lair alone.
Probes further into the dangerous lair despite warnings, showing determination but ignoring others' concerns.
Uses a powerful command to cause a landslide that endangers himself but ultimately confronts the Urlanders face to face.
Probes further into the dangerous lair despite warnings, showing determination and investigative skill.
Notices the hot rocks and finds a dragon scale, demonstrating keen observation and knowledge.
Uses an amulet to command a landslide to collapse the lair, showing confident use of magical or strategic power.
Runs for his life and is injured by falling rocks during the landslide, indicating some risk-taking but also vulnerability.
Climbs out of shelter to assess the aftermath of his actions, showing awareness of the situation.
Grins triumphantly but fails to inspire confidence or trust in the Urlanders, indicating a possible lack of social or leadership skill.
Enters the hall tattered, bedraggled and triumphant after facing the sorcerer and the dragon.
Boasts about his achievement and dismisses others' beliefs as superstition.
Boldly confronts the monk with a fireball, causing the monk to retreat.
Declares Vermithrax dead through his own power and ancient wisdom, confidently dismissing superstition.
Demonstrates magical ability by producing a fireball to intimidate Brother Jacopus, showing skill and control.
Brags about his achievements and dismisses others' beliefs as superstition, which may indicate overconfidence or arrogance.
Entertains a crowd of wide-eyed kids and adults with playful tricks.
Entertains a crowd of children and adults with sleight of hand tricks, such as pulling duck's eggs out of ears and making coins disappear.
Does not react negatively or lose composure when the crowd's attention shifts away from him to Valerian.
Takes shy Valerian by the hand and politely leads her to dance despite her shyness.
Tries to engage Valerian in conversation during the dance, teasing gently but encouraging her to open up.
Takes Valerian by the hand and leads her to dance with polite confidence despite her shyness.
Engages Valerian in light conversation during the dance, attempting to ease her discomfort.
Fails to notice or address Valerian's continued silence and discomfort beyond light teasing.
Expresses suspicion and distrust toward the King's gratitude, fearing betrayal.
Smiles reassuringly at Valerian, showing calm and friendly demeanor despite tense situation.
Questions the sincerity of the King's gratitude, showing suspicion and awareness of potential danger.
Decides not to resist or flee immediately despite the threat, choosing to comply with the summons to court.
Reassures Valerian confidently that he will return, indicating self-assurance and calm under pressure.
Attempts to entertain the court with a water trick and light humor despite the King's cold reception.
Continues his demonstration even after the King shows disinterest and displeasure.
Successfully creates ice in a goblet by magical means, demonstrating skill and knowledge.
Fails to impress the King and courtiers with his demonstration; the King's reaction is cold and dismissive.
Attempts to animate a table to fly, causing a chaotic scene with spilled wine and broken crockery.
Acknowledges the King's interruption and does not persist unnecessarily.
Refuses payment for his service, stating magical practice is its own reward and seeks only a greater challenge.
Responds to the King's skepticism with calm confidence and a bit of impatience ('What failure? What's the matter with you people?') rather than hostility.
Sits alone in a dungeon cell, quietly contemplating his amulet after being imprisoned, showing no bitterness or anger.
Refuses payment, stating that magical practice is its own reward and seeks greater challenge.
Confidently claims the dragon is dead despite the King's skepticism.
Does not show visible signs of panic or despair when thrown into a dungeon; instead, contemplates his amulet thoughtfully.
Attempts a complex magical ritual to escape or improve his situation despite frustration.
Responds politely and calmly to Elspeth, who brings him food and blankets.
Looks Elspeth over with admiration, noting her angelic appearance.
Inscribes a pentagram and runic signs, attempts to cast a spell to open his cell window.
Waits a long time for the spell to work, then becomes frustrated and rattles the bars.
Responds authoritatively and confidently when attempting magic.
Does not immediately understand Elspeth's explanation about the dragon and the lottery.
Questions Elspeth skeptically about her participation in the drawings, showing doubt but apologizes for believing rumors.
Engages Elspeth in conversation and shows some concern by asking how long he must stay.
Questions the morality of sacrificing a few for many, showing critical thinking.
Expresses skepticism about Elspeth's participation in the drawing, indicating awareness and caution.
Sighs and dismisses his own question, showing hesitation and lack of confidence in communication.
Asks how long he must stay in the room, showing a desire for information and clarity.
No direct action related to competence in the scene with the King and Tyrian; mostly passive observer.
Rolls off his straw palette and gets to his feet when the tremor shakes his cell, showing alertness and readiness.
Is bounced off the walls during the violent shaking, indicating vulnerability to the situation but no clear failure or panic shown.
Escapes from his cell after the earthquake, showing quick thinking and urgency.
Avoids confrontation with Tyrian by retreating and running away.
Steals a horse to escape, disregarding the panic and chaos caused to others.
Charges through the throne room and kitchen on horseback, causing destruction and chaos.
Picks himself up after the earthquake, notices the door off its hinges, and darts out of his cell promptly.
When confronted by Tyrian with a drawn sword, he warily retreats and then sprints away, avoiding direct confrontation.
Seizes the opportunity to mount a runaway horse to escape, showing quick thinking and adaptability.
Despite the gate closing in his face, he quickly reacts by turning the horse around and charging back into the building to evade capture.
Gallops through the throne room, knocking over furniture but maintaining control of the horse and continuing his escape.
Navigates chaos in the kitchen by reining in the horse and squeezing through a narrow hallway, demonstrating control and spatial awareness.
Runs into a contingent of footmen coming from the opposite direction, suggesting a potential trap or lack of full situational awareness.
Rides the horse aggressively into walls and through stairs to escape enemies, showing determination and quick thinking.
Escapes through a broken wall to freedom without hesitation, prioritizing survival over confrontation.
Rides the horse skillfully through narrow hallways and up stairs while evading enemies.
Quickly identifies an escape route through a weakened wall and acts decisively to flee.
Gets trapped in the library with enemies closing in.
Attempts to join the bucket brigade to help with the fire.
Is rejected and physically attacked by villagers blaming him for the disaster.
Seeks help from Greil in a moment of danger.
Barges into Valerian's house seeking refuge.
Attempts to join the bucket brigade to help with the fire.
Is immediately rejected and physically attacked by villagers blaming him for the disaster.
Runs away from hostile villagers instead of confronting them.
Seeks help from Greil, showing initiative but receives condemnation instead.
Barges into Valerian's house and secures the door behind him, taking a defensive position.
Admits he cannot help and calls himself a fraud and imposter.
Sinks to the floor, showing vulnerability and despair instead of anger or denial.
Refuses to act to help others despite urgent need.
Unfolds himself from a cramped trap door with determination.
Examines weapons carefully, tests and rejects them thoughtfully.
Expresses doubt about the sharpness of the swords, indicating high standards.
Does not engage warmly with others; interaction is focused on the task and weapons.
Carefully examines and tests multiple swords, rejects those not sharp enough, shows discernment and high standards.
Unfolds himself from a cramped trap door with determination, indicating resourcefulness and resolve.
Questions the smith about forging weapons, showing awareness of his own limitations and seeking expertise.
Walks into the stream and carefully tests the sword in the water, showing concern beyond just Valerian's fate.
Shows doubt and hesitation about the task ahead, indicating sincerity and vulnerability.
Walks into the shallows and positions the sword-tip to split the current, demonstrating understanding of the sword's properties and testing it carefully.
Shows doubt on his face when Valerian dismisses the danger, indicating uncertainty or lack of full confidence.
Recognizes the need for the amulet to proceed, showing awareness of necessary tools and preparation.
Disguises himself among common folk to avoid detection, blending in without causing alarm.
Acknowledges the princess politely when Valerian points her out, indicating familiarity.
Pulls his hat low over his eyes to avoid being recognized during a dangerous moment.
Disguises himself effectively among the crowd to avoid detection during a dangerous public event.
Pulls his hat low over his eyes to conceal his identity when a bounty is announced on him.
Engages in casual conversation with Valerian, showing awareness of the situation and people around him.
Sees his chance to act when the crowd is distracted and an unguarded door is near the stable.
Sneaks into the castle and searches thoroughly for the amulet, showing determination but no hostile intent.
Avoids confrontation by asking for a weapon before fighting, indicating a preference for fairness.
Lurks in the shadows of Simon's metal shop looking out on the square where Greil is holding forth
Receives the amulet from the King, who entrusts him with the mission to save the King's daughter, indicating trust in Galen's capability.
Lurks in the shadows of the blacksmith's shop, observing the square quietly without engaging or taking visible action.
Quietly shuts and bars the door before performing the ritual to reforge the sword, showing focus and seriousness.
Uncovers the sword and places his hand on the amulet, invoking a powerful incantation to reforge the sword.
Quietly shuts and bars the door, moves deeper into the workroom, assesses the coals and determines the fire is not the right kind.
Uncovers the sword, recites an incantation, and causes the sword to glow and heat up, enabling Simon to reforge it.
Clasped hands with Simon in a gesture of mutual respect and satisfaction after testing the reforged sword.
Expressed gratitude to Simon with a sincere 'Well done, Simon. Thank you.'
Understood Simon's regret about Valerian's absence without complaint or bitterness.
Did not verbally respond to the vision of Valerian, instead turned to see her in person, showing respect and attentiveness.
Successfully tests the reforged sword, demonstrating its power and effectiveness.
Calmly prepares for battle by equipping himself with armor and gear methodically.
Shows emotional composure and focus despite the gravity of the situation and possible farewell.
Thanks Valerian sincerely for the shield.
Acknowledges his love honestly when asked.
Takes Valerian in his arms and kisses her tenderly when she is trembling.
Turns the shield over and over, marveling at it; fixes Valerian with a piercing look and thanks her.
Acknowledges the presence of hatchlings and states they will have to be killed too, showing awareness of the situation.
Engages emotionally with Valerian, taking her in his arms and kissing her, showing confidence in personal relationships.
Materializes suddenly to interrupt the unjust proceedings and commands Horsrik and soldiers to leave.
Raises hands in a menacing gesture to intimidate opponents.
Materializes suddenly in front of enemies, causing them to retreat without a fight.
Raises hands in a menacing gesture to intimidate opponents.
Does not engage in direct combat when challenged by Tyrian, allowing a confrontation to remain unresolved.
Cuts Princess Elspeth's chains to free her and urges her to run to safety.
Draws sword and fights Tyrian aggressively, showing readiness to kill.
Shouts at Elspeth to stop when she walks into danger, showing concern for her safety.
Kills the King's man Tyrian to protect Elspeth and himself.
Enters the dragon's lair calling out for Elspeth, showing concern and urgency.
Kills the basilisks feeding on Elspeth's corpse, acting to protect her dignity.
Edges around Elspeth's remains cautiously, shrieks and jumps away when attacked by a creature, then stabs repeatedly to defend himself.
Leaps out to attack the dragon after it has killed its offspring, showing determination to protect or avenge the young dragons.
Focuses on fighting the dragon aggressively despite personal danger, but no explicit indication of kindness or friendliness in this excerpt.
Uses a dragon scale shield to deflect the dragon's flame, saving his life.
Springs to his feet and retreats quickly despite being singed and under attack.
Leaps out from cover and strikes the dragon's neck with his sword, successfully wounding it.
Loses half of his sword during the attack and is knocked to the ground by the dragon's thrashing.
Drops to the floor under his shield to protect himself from falling rocks and dragon flame.
Fondly regards Valerian after hearing Simon's words.
Contemplates Ulrich's remains silently, dismisses it as 'nothing' when asked.
Does not react or respond when Valerian asks if he loves her, seems distant and uncommunicative.
Endures severe injuries and remains conscious, showing physical resilience.
Does not respond emotionally or verbally when Valerian tries to engage him, appearing distant and unreactive.
Listens carefully to Simon's words about the future and the fading of magic, indicating awareness and thoughtfulness.
Sits up and shows affection toward Valerian, demonstrating emotional connection despite his condition.
Carefully packs his belongings and contemplates the leather pouch with Ulrich's remains, showing deliberate and reflective behavior.
Dismisses Valerian's question about the pouch with a vague answer, possibly avoiding deeper discussion.
Expresses concern for poor Hodge in a quiet moment.
Does not take Valerian's offered hand and abruptly leaves her side.
Tucks the pouch away, throws clothes on top, and ties the satchel shut.
Stops suddenly on the path, has a sudden inspiration, flings off his sack, drops to his knees, and tears through the contents, scattering gear on the trail.
Leaves his belongings behind and rushes back down the trail to confront someone, driven by urgency and concern.
Ignores Valerian's pleas and runs toward danger despite her attempts to stop him.
Recognizes a planned trap and insists on confronting it despite risks, showing insight and determination.
Leaves his belongings scattered on the trail, possibly indicating carelessness or lack of preparation.
Ignores Valerian's pleas and rushes headlong toward danger, suggesting impulsiveness and poor judgment.
Insists Valerian not come with him, saying 'this is my job,' but then follows her when she goes in anyway.
Grabs Valerian's hand and tells her to stay close while navigating the dangerous passage.
Tells Valerian to wait while he investigates further, showing protective caution.
Insists on doing the dangerous task himself, showing confidence and a sense of responsibility.
Quickly grabs a torch to light the way and leads Valerian through the lair, demonstrating preparedness and leadership.
Tells Valerian to stay close, showing awareness and protective instincts.
Darts off alone after telling Valerian to wait, indicating decisiveness but also potential risk-taking or lack of communication.
Crosses the dangerous lake of fire and performs a ritual with Ulrich's ashes, showing courage and knowledge of magical procedures.
Despite the ritual and quakes, no immediate results occur, and he remains crouched to keep balance, showing patience and composure under pressure.
Calls out to Ulrich excitedly and shows relief at his return, throws himself at his master's feet.
Crouches to keep his balance during a strong quake, maintaining composure.
Stares bleakly into the flames without immediate action, showing passivity.
Recognizes and calls out to Ulrich as he reforms, showing awareness and presence of mind.
Throws himself at his master's feet in a display of emotion rather than strategic action.
Insists on sharing a personal, vulnerable truth despite urgency, admitting he is not who he thought he was.
Insists on sharing an important personal revelation despite being urged to hurry, showing self-awareness and honesty.
Appears physically weak or incapacitated, needing to be helped to his feet by Ulrich.
Runs to Valerian and embraces her upon seeing her emerge from hiding.
Reluctantly parts with the amulet when Ulrich asks for it despite personal attachment.
Clings to Valerian in terror during the vortex experience.
Refuses to destroy the amulet and Ulrich despite the command, showing emotional conflict.
Reluctantly parts with the amulet when urged by Ulrich despite personal attachment.
Clings to Valerian in terror during the vortex experience.
Expresses willingness to do anything when challenged by Ulrich.
Refuses to destroy the amulet and send Ulrich back despite being told it is necessary.
Takes back the amulet reluctantly, showing respect and awe.
Refuses to smash the granite chunk if it means killing Ulrich.
Takes back the amulet reluctantly, showing caution and respect for its power.
Watches the dragon and Ulrich's confrontation carefully, indicating awareness and patience.
Refuses to smash the granite chunk if it means killing Ulrich, showing moral judgment but possibly hesitation in critical moments.
Refuses to kill Ulrich despite the danger, showing restraint and moral consideration.
Seizes the granite block to destroy the amulet and stop the dragon, acting decisively to protect others.
Grabs for the stone from Valerian, showing urgency and concern.
Seizes the granite block and decisively smashes the amulet, destroying the dragon.
Initially hesitates or argues about taking an action that could kill Ulrich (the sorcerer).
Accepts a staff from Valerian when limping, showing openness to help.
Does not respond to Valerian's expression of love and support, remains silent.
Reaches out to help Valerian mount the horse, showing care and attentiveness.
Refuses to rest despite limping, showing determination and resilience.
Briefly closes his eyes and mutters something before a horse appears, suggesting possible awareness or control over events.
Responds simply and logically to Valerian's question about the horse, attributing it to chance or wildness rather than claiming credit.
Falls a step behind and mutters something quietly, which could indicate internal processing or uncertainty.
Reaches out to help her up, offers assistance patiently.
Offers help to Valerian to get up and skillfully mounts the horse, then confidently rides off.
